title: How to Work Around Not Having a Compatible Graphics Adapter for DirectX 9

steps.headline: Check if the game or software you're trying to run requires DirectX 9.
steps.description: It may work with older versions of DirectX.

steps.headline: Check if the game can run in an alternate rendering mode such as openGL or software.
steps.description: For openGL you'll need to be able to run the required version of openGL.

steps.headline: Go to a computer shop near you, or visit dell website.
a Look around and pick a computer you like.
b Choose a computer, and customize it to your liking.
Voila, now you have a great computer, with a good graphic card.

text: Check if the game or software you're trying to run requires DirectX 9. It may work with older versions of DirectX. Check if the game can run in an alternate rendering mode such as openGL or software. For openGL you'll need to be able to run the required version of openGL. Go to a computer shop near you, or visit dell website. (If buying from dell, skip to 2b.) a Look around and pick a computer you like. Visit many stores for pricing. b Choose a computer, and customize it to your liking.  purchase it.  Voila, now you have a great computer, with a good graphic card.
